Overview

The inventory system notifies the allocation system whenever there is an update to an inventory, such as the generation of a new Purchase Order (PO) or on-hand inventory has increased due to receipt of new inventory. The allocation system will allocate the inventory for which a notification is received based on the expected demand at the respective stores and channels.

After the allocators review and approve the allocations, the allocation system will send a notification back to the inventory management system about the percentage ratios in which the DC inventory should be segmented for the respective channels based on the planned allocations.

 

Process Flow

 

Inventory Update

The inventory system will update the allocation system about the inventory update (New PO/ASN, On-hand change etc.).

API: {{url}}/inventory/api/inventory/supply/supplyEvent

 

Inventory Change Event

 

API : {{url}}/inventory/api/inventory/supply/supplyEvent

Allocation Trigger

Based on the inventory update, allocation will be triggered for the inventory supply.

 

Allocation Review & Submission

The allocators will review the system's suggested allocations for the inventory supply and submit the allocations for approval after making the required changes.

 

Allocation Approval

Allocation supervisors will review and approve the allocations.

 

Send Segment Plan to Inventory System

On approval, the inventory segment plan will be sent to the inventory system to segment the inventory as per the approved allocation quantities.

 

Queue: ALL_MAO_InventorySegmentExport

 

Note: Only % values are sent in the segment plan; units are not sent.

Inventory Segmentation In Inventory System

The Inventory system will use the segment plan and segment the inventory based on the segment plan.

 

API : {{url}}/inventory/api/inventory/resegment

 

Examples:

1. SegmentByInventoryAttribute is true: Inventory will be segmented by Inventory attribute.

 

Channel 1: Retail, Store1 and Store 2.

Channel 2: E-Commerce

Channel 3: Wholesale

Supply 1: On-hand, Quantity:50 Units, Inventory Attribute = Brand 1

Configuration

 

SegmentByInventoryAttribute: When SegmentByInventoryAttribute is set to true, inventory in Omni Inventory will be segmented by Inventory attribute.

 

{

"InventoryConfigValue": "true",

"InventoryConfigId": "SegmentByInventoryAttribute"

}
